thread.title_full: NYPD: New Citywide Anti-Crime Team Issued to Keep Guns Off Streets

author: Ryan Haas
title: NYPD: New Citywide Anti-Crime Team Issued to Keep Guns Off Streets
text:
Share Photo credit: Theodore Parisienne | New York Daily News 
(By: Faith Elliott ) Calling it a “very targeted enforcement against people that carry guns and commit violent acts,” NYPD Chief of Department James O’Neill announced creation of the Citywide Anti-Crime Team, a new NYPD unit whose sole mission is to rid the streets of guns. 
O’Neill was adamant that the unit would be nothing like the Street Crime Unit that was disbanded in 1999 after Amadou Diallo, an unarmed immigrant, was shot 19 times by officers while reaching for his wallet. 
“This is something that we talk about all the time,” O’Neill said. “We know the geography. We know the people involved. So it just makes sense to have a group of seasoned cops and supervisors target those individuals – and that’s how we’re going to push violence down further than it is now.” 
O’Neill said that rather than doing “jump outs” and making street arrests, this unit will concentrate on gathering intelligence. 
The new Citywide Anti-Crime Team will be an offshoot of the NYPD’s Strategic Response Group, formed to focus on counter-terrorism issues and provide a permanent group of police personnel to deal with crime spikes and trends, officials said. 
The unit is composed of two lieutenants, four sergeants and 16 police officers, according to O’Neill. 
“A lot of what they’re going to do is investigative work based on intel gleaned from people we lock up, from data that we have,” O’Neill said. “These are people that want to be there and are dedicated to this type of work.” 
No weapons seizures have been reported yet by the unit, which has been working for about two weeks.
